column3: str
Lumull is vibrating with nervous energy.
Speak with Eyaney.
Speak with Eyaney again.
Survey the vantage point.
Survey the next vantage point.
Survey the next vantage point.
Use the synthetic desensitizer on the lightning sprites.
Speak with Eyaney.
One wonders how fearsome this Eyaney truly is...
If Treno's barrier is similar in design to Alexandria's, should we assume that electrope technology is standard here as well?
At the moment, Eyaney should be waiting just past that park.
Let's be off before anyone changes their mind!
Lumull is sweating rather profusely...
Whenever we meet an engineer from some distant land, I can't help but wish to introduce them to our friends at the Ironworks. Such a firestorm of questions there would be...
(Breathe in... Breathe out...)
They put one in mind of another pair of siblings we know, don't they?
<gasp> I entirely forgot to ask your names! Do forgive me.
I am Krile, and this is <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>.
Accompanying Lumull is G'raha Tia, our own technology enthusiast.
It's lovely to meet you!
It feels strange putting you to work, but I'd be lying if I said I don't need the help.
In the wake of an event like this, I presume a great deal of labor is required to restore everything to working order...
The volume of fixes that need making is one matter, but I could handle it if it weren't for these legs of mine. The paralysis flares up at the worst times, I swear...
I can manage a bit of shuffling from one station to the other on a good day, but I usually leave racing around the city to my brother.
With him off to the mine, though, someone else needs to take care of the lightning sprites. They're drawn to the discharged aether of slain creatures.
I'd offer you the detector to make tracking them down easier, but seeing as Lumull has managed to break it yet again... <sigh>
I do have this, though. Toss some at a sprite, and you can suppress its ability to sense aether nearby. That usually gets them wandering out of the city towards more fertile ground.
So we needn't fight them?
We find it's safer not to. When threatened, they'll siphon energy from facilities we need to keep our medical services running, or emit bursts that overload nearby systems.
For the same reason, I recommend you stick to thoroughfares that will allow you to spot them well in advance. I would hate for you to be injured while helping us.
Understood.
We'll want to split up again to cover more ground. Are you ready to go?
I appreciate the help. I'll be here working on the detector while you're away.
Though you scan the area thoroughly, you see no lightning sprites.
Though you scan the area thoroughly, you see no lightning sprites.
Lightning sprites! The time to test your tossing arm has arrived...
Guests are always welcome in Treno. I hope you're enjoying your time here!
You're back! Were there many sprites?
Just a handful on your route, then? Could be worse!
Still, it's important to keep the city free of them. We're much obliged!
